WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for filing this issue. Fortunately or unfortunately, this is simply how JavaScript's Array constructor works. There's no way for us to distinguish intentional from unintentional behavior here.
WorkItem.Description:
var arr1=  [1]; // first element is 1

var arr2 = new Array(2,3); // first and second elements are 2 and 3
var arr3 = new Array(4); // first element is 'undefined'.  This is an array of 4 elements!!!
WorkItem.Summary: Suggestion: Disambiguate between array constructor call and initialization

Comments.Message: True it is not a bug.  That is why I said suggestion.  It would be nice if Typescript can generate some kind of warning with the array constructor function.
